required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Administration of Four Lactobacillus Species Preparation to Improve the Quality of the Neovaginal Flora in Male to Female Transsexual Patients

collaborator.agency: University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences, Vienna, Austria

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is the improvement of the penile linked neovaginal flora in male-to-female transsexuals after application of oral probiotics.

primary_outcome.measure: change in Nugent score between baseline and end of treatment (improvement or no improvement).
primary_outcome.time_frame: day 0 day 7 of oral probiotic application
primary_outcome.description: Using Nugent scoring system, from each participant first swab from neovagina and rectum will be taken before start of oral probiotic use.(baseline information) Second swab from neovagina and rectum will be taken on the day following the last administration.(information about change in Nugent)

secondary_outcome.measure: Isolation of specific Lactobacilli from neovaginal microbiologic cultures after oral administration of probiotic
secondary_outcome.description: From each participant, the swab from neovagina and rectum for microbiologic cultures will be taken on the day following the last administration. Isolation of oral applied probiotic strains.

other_outcome.time_frame: day 0 day 7 of oral probiotic application

clinical_study.condition: Reduction or Absence of Lactobacilli in Neovaginal Flora

intervention.description: lyophilised L. rhamnosus, L. jensenii, L. crispatus, L. gasseri and sodium alginate
control group would receive a oral lactose placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Participants underwent the sex reassignment surgery (SRS) with the technique of the inverted penile skin flap longer than 1 year.
All transsexual women treated according to the Standards of Care of the World Professional Association of Transgender Health (WPATH).
Exclusion Criteria:
- clinical signs of vaginal or urinary tract infection,
- abnormal neovaginal discharge,
- neoplasia,
- bleeding,
- diarrhoea,
- constipation,
- rectal pathologies including hemorrhoids,
- antibiotic therapy in the previous 4 weeks

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gyecology, AKH
